page.title: 06Modern Farming
page.content: Farms used to keep all sorts of animals and grow a variety of crops. Now, to make a living, farmers have to specialise in just one sort of farming. Round Kingsley the farming is mainly dairying. The cows are mainly Fresians (or a Fresian-Hereford cross) which give a lot of milk - about 50 litres a day. Some grass is left to grow for hay, which is cut with a forage harvester in June. Other crops are not usually grown. Manure from the cows is run into slurry pit, and this is put on the fields with a slurry spreader. Milking is all done by machines in milking parlours. Tanker lorries collect the milk each day. Some farmers use a computer to calculate the exact feed needed by each cow, and to analyse the quality of the milk.
